description: P.S.T. officially opened its doors on October 2015 and is the new addition to the infamous Park Street Mews pedestrian road, located in the heart of Colombo. Spanning over two floors, the ambiance of the restaurant is welcoming and evoke a warm “home” feeling with details of an industrial trattoria-style restaurant. There is an open kitchen with wood burning oven and a see-through cellar where all the imported cold cuts and cheeses are kept. P.S.T. menu features classic Italian appetizers, pasta & risotti, main courses, pizzas and sides. Simple and fresh ingredients are key for traditional Italian dishes made with the addition of the finest ingredients imported from Italy and freshly sourced local produces. P.S.T. focuses on encouraging their diners to embrace an age old Italian concept of sharing the food. To complete the dining experience at PST you can enjoy traditional Italian desserts and homemade traditional il Gelato ice cream.

description: Upali's with its array of dishes with the best Sri Lankan flavours offers you a truly homely and unique culinary experience. Our signature dishes are mouthwateringly delicious, and the rest of the dishes and desserts on the menu will keep you coming back for more. Our menu is incomparably rich vis-a-vis taste and quality and we pride ourselves on exclusively serving traditional Sri Lankan fare. Located in the heart of Colombo, Upali's affords breathtaking views of tranquil Viharamahadevi Park, the majestic Nelum Pokuna Theatre and the iconic Town Hall. We also serve locally brewed coffee, favourite local snacks and pastries at the Coffee Shop which is located just a few steps away from the main restaurant. In the midst of the hustle and bustle of Colombo life, Upali's offers you the perfect escape from the daily routine and satisfies your taste buds. The interior adorned with alluring local paintings and old photographs of Ceylon add a touch of artistic sophistication. As you sit down for a hearty meal you can revel in the elegance and charm we have created for you, complete with autographed memorabilia by cricketers and other celebrities that have dined with us. The garden ambiance, a hallmark at Upali's, complements the view of the park right outside. We have specially designed areas upstairs to host events ranging from birthday parties to company meetings and reunions. Our function room which is situated on the top floor of the Coffee Shop can accommodate up to 85 pax for a seated event and up to 100 pax standing, is available to hire for private events. Free WIFI access and other amenities are at your disposal to ensure your visit to Upali's is a pleasant one. The temptingly delicious meals at Upali's will redefine your food indulgence. We look forward to having you over soon!

description: Step inside our t-Lounge on Chatham Street and leave the hustle and the bustle of the world behind. Sink into an armchair, unwind to the easy rhythm of soft music, breath in the fragrant air of cinnamon mingled with tea sip a cup of Dilmah tea and wrap yourself in a timeless cocoon of luxury. Located in the beautifully restored Dutch Square in the heart of Colombo Fort, the t-Lounge by Dilmah takes you on a tea inspired journey of unparalleled sensory experience. Indulge in the finest luxury range of designer gourmet leaf tea, experiment with flavours, immerse yourself in the colourful traditions of tea culture, and get acquainted with tea as you have never before. Explore our matchless array of artisan-crafted teas and tea-inspired food. From the curious to the convert there's something for everyone. Welcome to the t-Lounge on Chatham Street by Dilmah: Welcome to the world of 'real' tea!

description: Botanik has been conceptualized and created by Cantaloupe & Co. to encompass a lifestyle venue with Botanical elements presented in the space through real life, art, design, and its food and beverage. We have teamed up with Chef Rishi Naleendra, a brilliant young Sri Lankan Chef who incidentally just won his first Michelin Star a few weeks prior to our opening. He has received international acclaim for his restaurant Cheek By Jowl in Singapore, which is now famed for its modern Australian Faire. We are huge fans of his work and the infectious spirit he injects to all his projects. The Botanik beverage experience has been curated by our F&B Director hailing from Brittany in France; Mathieu Delin, who started his career as a Sommelier in his home country. His diverse international experience, and portfolio shines through in his beverage menu and is punctuated by his unrelenting passion. Botanik is made up of three main areas - The Contemporary Bistro, The Terrace and The Verandah.

description: Urban Kitchen, popular among patrons for its extensive menu, laid back ambience and exquisite food, has introduced its latest menu, bursting with delectable options that are sure to satisfy tastebuds, regardless of the type of cuisine one craves. With a whopping 233 choices inspired by Italian, Mexican, Japanese, Chinese, Malaysian, Thai, European and Middle Eastern cuisines, patrons will be forgiven for pouring over the menu for much longer than usual. But with so many mouthwatering selections, several visits will be required to try out all of the dishes that catch one’s attention. The new 25-page menu features an assortment of Starters and Snacks, Soups and Salads, Sandwiches and Wraps, Burgers, Pizzas, Pastas and Risottos, Sushi, Sashimi and Rotis, not to mention a revamped choice of hot and cold beverages. Vegetarians too have an extensive choice of over 30 dishes to choose from and a special corner of the menu is dedicated specially for kids.For a quick snack or an appetizer before a large meal, the Urban Nachos – cheese, salsa fresco, sour cream, frijoles and fresh guacamole on a bed of crisp tortilla corn chips – are a popular choice. Peking Duck Pockets – crispy skinned roast duck served with pancakes, cucumber, spring onions and hoisin sauce – is another favourite. The chefs also recommend the Vietnamese Rice Paper Rolls, available in a choice of fillings including prawn, chicken or vegetable.

description: Silk, Gunpowder, Printing and the Compass are among the great Chinese Inventions that have altered the course of history. The reason for the enduring worldwide popularity of Chinese food begins with the cornucopia of unique ingredients, plus subtle or emphatic sauces and seasonings that are partnered.Transforming this variety of ingredients into memorable works of culinary art is just what our Team of Chinese Chefs lead by Master Chef HUASHENG MO are best at. At TSING TAO every dish must meet three major criteria appearance, fragrance and flavor. The other considerations are texture, the health giving properties of the food and it’s auspicious connotations. This purpose in mind all our seafood, meat and vegetables, are purchased daily to ensure freshness and taste. description: Sizzlers are a recent 'inno-vention' that consists of an entire meal being served on a cast iron platter, which is in turn placed on a wooden base and served sizzling to your table. Sizzlers probably originated a few centuries ago when meat was served on a heated cast iron plate to keep it piping hot, while the diner ate his meal. Today, however, they have become a cuisine of sorts by themselves as many specialty restaurants serve only Sizzlers on their menu. A sizzler is a combination of a main dish served with a choice of sauces and a large variety of accompaniments, making it a complete meal by itself! "The SIZZLE" presents a new line of cuisine to the local palette with great authentic Halal recipes presented in a creative manner, resulting in innovative recipes, delectable combinations, bathed in herbs, eastern flavors - a sense of fusion in taste with a tantalizing aroma. Platters of mouthwatering meats, seafood and veggie delights served sizzling to your table.

description: Situated at the former Dutch Hospital right opposite the World Trade Center, Semondu opened its wings to the public offering an international menu with a twist of oriental Sri Lankan fusion. Guests who always love to see how what they have ordered is being prepared have the chance to sit at the bar and just observe the master chefs at works through the open kitchen, dishing out an array of fusion cuisine, mixing flavours and tasting the different spices in each dish. Serving a wide choice from starters, salads, soups and main courses the restaurant not only speaks food but it speaks of a history many have forgotten. There are picture hung on walls of the ancestral times giving a glimpse of how Sri Lanka was then and a taste of Dutch architecture of the bygone era. With seats ready to accommodate around 64 guests, the 31 staff that have being trained straight from the SriLankan Catering Kitchen at Katunayake are ready on the go to serve the guest inside as well as outside verandah.

description: Our name reflects the powerful connection between the unequaled collection of ingredients in our country that's at the heart of our restaurant and exceptional skill of our F& B and Culinary teams to capture the true essence of natures textures and tastes. rare builds on the award-winning approach developed by all UGA Escapes properties since 2012. For our Chefs and their teams, instinct, insight and invention are what matters. While many of the ingredients for rare come direct from our own organic farms in the East Coast and Cultural Triangle, others are sourced from carefully chosen suppliers across Sri Lanka. What they all have in common is a commitment to supplying ingredients in their prime, giving us the freedom to create food that's inventive, exciting and spontaneous - and exclusive. These exceptional ingredients are combined with sensitivity, wit and ingenuity, often revealing unexpected new dimensions. At rare, flavour is king, and change is a cherished constant.
